text: A petition to prevent whitewashing in the upcoming "Mulan" remake starts picking up serious
steam. Disney announced a live-action remake of the classic animated movie back in April 2015.
Fans of the 1998 film, based on the Chinese legend of Hua Mulan, are worried Hollywood's
tendency to whitewash characters of color will continue. Natalie Molnar started an online
petition to convince Disney not to cast white actors in roles meant for people of color
in the "Mulan" remake. As of this recording on Sept. 13, the petition was less than 2,000
signatures away from reaching its goal of 90,000. Worth noting — the film's cast hasn't
even been announced yet. But Molnar points to recent films that have been denounced for
whitewashing, like "The Last Airbender" and the upcoming "Ghost in the Shell."
But others point to Disney's recent efforts to combat its history of whitewashing,
with its remake of "The Jungle Book" and the next Disney princess movie "Moana."
For NewsBeat Social, I'm Molly Riehl.
